availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Nolen (McCracken County, Kentucky, copper smith)

body.p: McCracken County, Kentucky, copper smith. Pennsylvania native. Married to Huldah A. Nolen. Father of Catharine, Mary J., William P., Nancy A., and Anna Nolen. Tinner and copper smith in McCracken County, Kentucky in 1850. Employed Henry Timberlake and Berryman Heyman as tinners in 1850. Resident of Paducah, Kentucky in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McCracken, Paducah and Suburbs, p. 277.
Find A Grave, "William Nolen (1813-1895)," Memorial #84269262, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/84269262 (accessed July 2, 2019).
